choices.A: Nothing else needs to be done; the rule should start working
choices.B: The rule group must be assigned to one or more prevention policies
choices.D: You must individually select which hosts you would like to apply to rule to
choices.C: The rule needs to be manually triggered to ensure it works as intended

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, based on check UI Dashboard

questions.question_text: After enabling an IOA rule and its respective rule group, what else must be done for an IOA to be fully functional?
Which of the following uses Regex to create a detection or take a preventative action?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, based on check UI Dashboard

choices.D: Custom IOA rules cannot be created for domains

questions.question_text: When creating a custom IOA for a specific domain, which syntax would be best for detecting or preventing on all subdomains as well?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
C works but is not the correct one, as it matches more than it should. notabaddomain.xyz would also match there since you dont request for a period . before the beggining of the text. 
A is the correct option.

Selected Answer: C
C is better with regards to scripting

Selected Answer: A
A. .*.baddomain.xyz|baddomain.xyz

This syntax ensures that all subdomains of baddomain.xyz (e.g., sub.baddomain.xyz) as well as the domain itself (baddomain.xyz) are covered. The .*\. part before the domain captures any subdomain, while baddomain\.xyz matches the domain itself. The pipe (|) acts as an OR operator

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. Checked on training

Selected Answer: A
Disagree with Brian. C is not specific enough and would match things like notabaddomain.xyz and baddomain.xyz.com

A is the best solution for specifically looking for subdomains of baddomain.xyz or just the domain itself which is what the question asked for.

Selected Answer: C
Tested in UI

questions.question_text: Which role is required to manage groups and policies in Falcon?

discussion.content: B is correct - checked with Falcon

Selected Answer: B
B ? going with B as its the only one that has "host" and "admin in it.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Prevention Hash Manager is not a real role. The 3 other roles do not exist unless you remove the word "Host". Therefore, the Falcon Administrator is the only role that is able to edit groups and policies.
